org.matrix.androidsdk.data

Class EventTimeline

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.matrix.androidsdk.data.EventTimeline

  • public class EventTimeline
extends java.lang.Object
    A `EventTimeline` instance represents a contiguous sequence of events in a room.

    There are two kinds of timeline:

    - live timelines: they receive live events from the events stream. You can paginate backwards but not forwards. All (live or backwards) events they receive are stored in the store of the current MXSession.

    - past timelines: they start in the past from an `initialEventId`. They are filled with events on calls of [MXEventTimeline paginate] in backwards or forwards direction. Events are stored in a in-memory store (MXMemoryStore).

      • resetPaginationAroundInitialEvent

        public void resetPaginationAroundInitialEvent(int limit,
                                              ApiCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Reset the pagination timelime and start loading the context around its `initialEventId`. The retrieved (backwards and forwards) events will be sent to registered listeners.
        Parameters:
        limit - the maximum number of messages to get around the initial event.
        callback - the operation callback
